content.raw:
Some tutorials have a next step suggestion on the bottom, for example this one:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=modifying_world&cat=build_world

I think this might come from a time when all tutorials were intended to follow a single thread to introduce all features of Gazebo. But now we:

* Have guided tutorials which have their own well-defined flow

* Have several new tutorials which don't have "Next"

* Have some "Next" steps which look out of place. For example, the link above is about modifying the world and has a next step to use elevation models. While this probably made sense back when a new user could be introduced to all of Gazebo's features following a few tutorials, now it might just confuse someone and make them think the "Next" step is required.
